title: Silver Rights: The story of the Carter family's brave decision to send their children to an all-white school and claim their civil rights
description: This “sure-to-be-classic account of 1960s desegregation” (Los Angeles Times) tells the inspiring story of the Carters, black Mississippi sharecroppers who sent their children to integrate an all-white school system. “Silver Rights is pure gold!” (Julian Bond). Introduction by Marian Wright Edelman.
author: Constance Curry
